revised_title: Tide-Observations at Bristol: Empirical Laws of Diurnal Inequalities
tldr: This paper presents a discussion of 19,000 tide observations at Bristol, aiming to determine the empirical laws of diurnal inequalities in tide times and heights. The author uses a self-registering tide-gauge and transit observations to analyze the data, finding that diurnal inequalities are not as minute as previously thought.
